pullRequest.body:
Show that an AddContent on a SetSemiring gives rise to an inducedOuterMeasure. All sets in the measurable structure generated by the SetSemiring are Carathéodory measurable.

Co-authored-by: Rémy Degenne [remy.degenne@inria.fr](mailto:remy.degenne@inria.fr)

-------

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [645c58a7da](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21353/commits/645c58a7da4e78402375f34cb399c092f37983c8)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.OuterMeasure.OfAddContent` (new file)|1346|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AddContent.IsSigmaSubadditive`
`+ addContent_iUnion_eq_tsum_of_disjoint_of_IsSigmaSubadditive`
`+ inducedOuterMeasure_eq`
`+ isCaratheodory_inducedOuterMeasure`
`+ isCaratheodory_inducedOuterMeasure_of_mem`
`+ isCaratheodory_ofFunction_of_mem`
`+ measure`
`+ measureCaratheodory`
`+ measureCaratheodory_eq`
`+ measureCaratheodory_eq_inducedOuterMeasure`
`+ measure_eq`
`+ ofFunction_eq`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: pfaffelh can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13230442155/job/36926793804)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13230442155/job/36926793913)

You can merge the PR once you have dealt with all the remaining comments. Thanks!
bors d+

This looks good!

Could you go through all conversations which are still open, resolve the ones for which you think everything is ok, and answer the other ones? Thanks!

You can merge the PR once you have dealt with all the remaining comments. Thanks!
bors d+

There is an `{s : Set α}` in many lemmas. It would be better here:
```suggestion
variable {α : Type*} {C : Set (Set α)} {s : Set α}
```
Done and deleted this variable in several lemmas.

```suggestion
Let `C` be a semiring of sets and `m` an additive content on `C`, which is sigma-subadditive.
Then all sets in the sigma-algebra generated by `C` are Carathéodory measurable with respect to
the outer measure induced by `m`. The induced outer measure is equal to `m` on `C`.
```
Ok, fewer types in docs. Done.

If we name it similarly to `ofFunction_addContent_eq`, the name should be
```suggestion
theorem inducedOuterMeasure_addContent_eq (hC : IsSetSemiring C) (m : AddContent C)
```
Yes, naming should be similar. Done.

```suggestion
  The outer measure induced by a sigma-subadditive content on a semiring is equal to the content
  on the sets of the semiring.
```
Changed.

```suggestion
theorem isCaratheodory_inducedOuterMeasure_of_mem (hC : IsSetSemiring C) (m : AddContent C)
```
Changed.

```suggestion
* `MeasureTheory.isCaratheodory_AddContentSemiring`: all sets of the semiring are Carathéodory
  measurable with respect to the outer measure induced by a sigma-subadditive content.
* `MeasureTheory.isCaratheodory_inducedOuterMeasure`: all sets of the sigma-algebra generated by
  the semiring are Carathéodory measurable with respect to the outer measure induced by a
  sigma-subadditive content.
```
Changed, as well as the new names of the lemmas.

```suggestion
/-- For `m : AddContent C` sigma-sub-additive, finite on `C`, the `inducedOuterMeasure` given by `m`
```
Thanks, changed.

I'd rather have this as `AddContent.measureCaratheodory`, to be able to use dot notation later on. The rest of the file would probably fit better in the `AddContent` namespace, correspondingly, and the other names would need adjusting.
This makes sense, changed, and adjusted the order of variables, and docstrings.
And this one would just be `AddContent.measure`.
Changed,

```suggestion
* `MeasureTheory.AddContent.measureCaratheodory_eq`: The measure
```
Done.
Now I have seen the spot and changed it.

Given how the assumption `m_sigma_subadd` shows up in all the statements in this file, I would give a definition `AddContent.isSigmaSubadditive` for this property (probably in the file on `AddContent`: in this way, you could write the assumption as `m.isSigmaSubadditive`, which is more readable.
I added that def.

Rémy has already added the def, under a different name. @pfaffelh, I can't see your renaming. Have you forgotten to push? Note that it should not be `AddContent.iUnion_le`, because there should be no underscore in it, so I think I prefer to keep `IsSigmaSubadditive`.
In fact I think you should even put the whole file in the `AddContent` namespace, because it's really the main player in all the statements.

```suggestion
* `MeasureTheory.AddContent.IsSigmaSubadditive`: an `AddContent` is σ-subadditive if
```
Since it's a prop, it should be upper-cased (here and below)

Done. However, the same property is called `iUnion_le` in `OuterMeasure`. Shouldn't the name be the same? And shouldn't we switch assumptions to `(m : AddContent C) (hC : IsSetSemiring C)` in order to have dot-notation?
In `OuterMeasure`, it's a field of a definition. Here, it's a standalone definition. So, they don't have the same status, and I don't think it's an issue if they don't have the same name.
Is it enough to assume `mα ≤ MeasurableSpace.generateFrom C` here? It would make it slightly easier to apply (just need to check one inequality instead of 2).

For the definition, this is ok. However, `measure_eq` then does not work with `mα ≤ MeasurableSpace.generateFrom C` but only with `mα = MeasurableSpace.generateFrom C`. If only `mα ≤ MeasurableSpace.generateFrom C`, any `s ∈ C`does not need to be measurable wrt `mα`.
I have now used `≤` in the definition. Not sure if this is usefule since the application of `measure_eq` requires `=`.

Is that really weaker? I would expect this is equivalent, because a non-disjoint union can be rewritten as a disjoint union thanks to the semiring property. Is that worth having (maybe even taking the version with the disjoint union as the definition, because then it's easier to check)?

You are right, it is not weaker. Apparently, `m.IsSigmaAdditive` => `m_subadd`. For <=, we would have to extend `addContent_sUnion_le_sum` to countable `J`. We would also have to extend the proof of `IsSetSemiring.disjointOfUnion_props` for countable `J`, hence the `Finset.cons_induction` in that proof would have to be extended.
Not sure if it is worth it. Note that this property does not appear in any definition. I put a TODO into the file, or is that no good style!?

The question is wether it would be useful for instance to the application to Kolmogorv extension theorem. If assuming disjointness does not simplify the proof of subadditivity, then I agree it's not worth investigating more, and leaving a todo is enough.
Ok, I resolve the issue since the proof of the Kolmogorov Extension Theorem works without this.

```suggestion
    Measure α :=
  (m.measureCaratheodory hC m_sigma_subadd).trim <|
    fun s a ↦ isCaratheodory_inducedOuterMeasure hC m s (hC_gen s a)
```
Done.

```suggestion
```
done.

```suggestion
with respect to the `inducedOuterMeasure` from `m` .-/
```
Done.

```suggestion
/-- Construct a measure from a sigma-subadditive content on a semiring. This
```
Done.
Could you also mention `measure_eq` here, as it's the statement one will use most of the time?
I added a description and a docstring.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Carathéodory's Extension Theorem
